meanings.definition: A person who compiles or maintains a catalog.
meanings.sent1: The cataloguer organized all the books in the library.
meanings.sent2: The cataloguer at the museum keeps track of all the artifacts.
meanings.sent3: The cataloguer tried to catalog all the toys in the playroom, but they kept moving around!
meanings.sent4: She was a cataloguer of memories, carefully storing each moment in her mind.
meanings.sent5: The diligent cataloguer meticulously arranged the documents in alphabetical order.

meanings.definition: To make a systematic list or inventory of items.
meanings.sent1: I need to cataloguer all the files on my computer for easy access.
meanings.sent2: The librarian will cataloguer the new books that arrived today.
meanings.sent3: He decided to cataloguer his collection of stamps to see how many he had.
meanings.sent4: She wanted to cataloguer the stars in the sky, but there were too many to count.
meanings.sent5: The scientist would cataloguer each specimen with precision and care.
